intro: Mairania, commonly known as the bluebell of the genus Mairania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Mairania species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
